credit_line: Gift of Myra and William H. Mathers
title: Sampler
provenance:
Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. This sampler was purchased by Brentano's from Mrs. Charles Gee, a direct descendant of Elizabeth Saggar, who worked it in 1734. $40
(MJL No. 40);  2002 appraisal #104
medium:
Medium: linen, silk
Technique: embroidery in cross, eyelet, and satin stitch with some looping stitches and detached needle looping
description: Long sampler embroidered in brown, blue, green, yellow and red silks on a natural linen ground.  Alphabets in cross and eyelet stitch; birds, flowers, animals, and boxing figures in cross stitch with some satin stitch and detached needle looping; floral bands in cross stitch and satin stitch.  The ground fabric is pieced across the middle.
name: Sampler
